document_title: How does tapeworm infect people? Signs and causes
subsection_content:
Tapeworm disease (also called tapeworm) causes a parasitic infection in the intestines. The cause is tapeworm eggs (pork tapeworm, beef tapeworm, fish tapeworm...) entering from animals into humans through the mouth, especially the habit of eating raw, undercooked or undercooked meat. Normally, a body infected with tapeworms will experience mild and non-specific symptoms such as fatigue, abdominal pain, and diarrhea. Symptoms can also vary depending on the type of tapeworm you have. (first)
Tapeworm infection is caused by eating food or water contaminated with tapeworm eggs or larvae
